articles.title: busting tech after 'seismic' drop in shoplifting
articles.description: A trial of facial recognition technology has led to a drop in shoplifting - but critics say supermarkets scanning customers' faces is 'treating shoppers like a rogue’s gallery to be monitored and surveilled'
articles.content:
EXCLUSIVE: Sainsbury's to roll out crime-busting tech after 'seismic' drop in shoplifting
A trial of facial recognition technology has led to a drop in shoplifting - but critics say supermarkets scanning customers' faces is 'treating shoppers like a ... [5578 chars]

articles.title: Are 'tech dense' farms the future of farming?
articles.description: A host of technology is on offer to farmers, promising to raise farming yields and lower food prices.
articles.content:
Jake Leguee is a third-generation farmer in Saskatchewan, Canada.
Since his grandfather bought the 17,000 acres in 1956, the Leguee family has grown canola, wheat, flax and green lentils.
As a child, he watched his father and grandfather spending hou... [3702 chars]

articles.title: iterature, memory and gender take centre stage at IIT Bhilai conference
articles.description:
staff reporter : the department of liberal arts,
indian institute of technology,
bhilai organised a two-day
national conference titled
‘gendered modalities of
remembering in south asian
literatures’ at the nalanda
lecture hall
articles.content:
Staff Reporter :
THE Department of Liberal Arts, Indian Institute of Technology, Bhilai organised a two-day national conference titled ‘Gendered Modalities of Remembering in South Asian Literatures’ at the Nalanda Lecture Hall IIT Bhilai. It brought ... [2561 chars]

articles.title: Bhopal News: Shiru Company Shows Interest In Madhya Pradesh’s Agriculture Sector At Davos
articles.description: Alon Stopel, Chairman of the Israel Innovation Authority, met Raghvendra Singh, Principal Secretary, Industry Promotion and Investment, to discuss cooperation in technology and innovation. Both sides agreed to explore a formal cooperation structure to strengthen technological pilots, innovation partnerships, and institutional contacts between Madhya Pradesh and Israel.
articles.content:
Bhopal (Madhya Pradesh): On the first day of the World Economic Forum in Davos on Monday, Jasmin Hume, founder and CEO of Shiru Company, expressed keen interest in Madhya Pradesh’s agriculture sector.
She held discussions with Principal Secretary, In... [2090 chars]

articles.title: Israel: 13 new projects will integrate AI into government ministries
articles.description: As part of the program, with a total investment of approximately NIS 40 million led by the Ministry of Innovation, Science and Technology and the National Digital System, the selected projects will receive professional guidance from AI experts from the public sector and academia, dedicated training and regulatory guidance that will ensure responsible implementation of the technology in government ministries.
articles.content: Tel Aviv [Israel], January 20 (ANI/TPS): The National Digital Directorate and the Ministry of Innovation, Science and Technology announced on Monday 13 new government projects that will receive support as part of the second call for proposals to inte... [1175 chars]

articles.title: Andaman, Nicobar Islands' biodiversity crucial for environmental security: Dr Jitendra
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent SRI VIJAYA PURAM (PORT BLAIR), Jan 19: Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Science & Technology, Earth Sciences, and MoS PMO, Personnel, Public Grievances, Pensions, Atomic Energy and Space, Dr. Jitendra Singh has said that Andaman & Nicobar Islands’ biodiversity is crucial for environmental and economic security. The Minister was highlighting the strategic importance of island biodiversity, during his visit to the Andaman & Nicobar Regional Centre of the Zoological Survey of India (ZSI) at Sri Vijaya […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
SRI VIJAYA PURAM (PORT BLAIR), Jan 19: Union Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Science & Technology, Earth Sciences, and MoS PMO, Personnel, Public Grievances, Pensions, Atomic Energy and Space, Dr. Jitendra Singh has... [3266 chars]

articles.title: AIKS delegation calls on Dr Jitendra, submits memorandum
articles.description: Excelsior Correspondent JAMMU, Jan 19: A delegation of All India Kashmiri Samaj (AIKS) led by its president, Ravinder Pandita called on Union Minister in PMO with Independent charge of Ministries of Science and Technology and Earth Sciences, Dr. Jitendra Singh in New Delhi today. The AIKS president handed over a memorandum addressed to Prime Minister on the eve of 36th Exodus Day highlighting the demands and plight of Kashmiri Pandits, who had to leave their homes and hearths in 1990. […]
articles.content:
Excelsior Correspondent
JAMMU, Jan 19: A delegation of All India Kashmiri Samaj (AIKS) led by its president, Ravinder Pandita called on Union Minister in PMO with Independent charge of Ministries of Science and Technology and Earth Sciences, Dr. Jite... [1472 chars]

articles.title: Audi Q5 2026 review: Sportback TFSI
articles.description: Audi’s latest Q5 Sportback brings mild-hybrid power, updated underpinnings, more technology and a genuinely impressive interior glow-up.
articles.content:
Likes
Interior glow-up is gorgeous
Comfortable ride with well-tuned suspension
Strong standard tech and safety features
Dislikes
Still manages to remind you its a base-grade
Rear seat & boot space on smaller side
Steering assist tends to overcorrect
... [12789 chars]

articles.title: 2 Nepalese ministers resign to contest elections
articles.description: KATHMANDU, Jan 19 : Two Nepalese ministers resigned on Monday from their posts to contest the upcoming general elections. The Himalayan nation is set to witness the House of Representatives election on March 5. Minister for Communication and Information Technology Jagdish Kharel submitted his resignation to Prime Minister Sushila Karki in the afternoon. The former television journalist resigned on the eve of the date fixed by the Election Commission to file nomination papers for the election. In his resignation letter, […]
articles.content:
By
Daily Excelsior
-
KATHMANDU, Jan 19 : Two Nepalese ministers resigned on Monday from their posts to contest the upcoming general elections.
The Himalayan nation is set to witness the House of Representatives election on March 5.
Minister for Commu... [1763 chars]
